document_title: Sleep apnea syndrome: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_name: ngung-tho-khi-ngu.json_9_Note for patients with sleep apnea
subsection_content:
To limit the unpleasant symptoms of sleep apnea and prevent disease progression, patients need to:
1. Coordinate closely with your doctor during treatment
It is important that patients have follow-up appointments with an Ear, Nose and Throat specialist or sleep specialist. Patients need to record any ongoing symptoms, difficulties encountered during treatment, other concerns... to notify the doctor.
2. Clean and maintain treatment equipment properly
Whether a patient uses a PAP device or a mouthpiece, cleaning and maintenance can help achieve the most effective treatment. This also helps avoid unwanted side effects.
3. Avoid high-risk activities
People with sleep apnea are at risk of daytime drowsiness and should avoid activities such as driving or operating heavy machinery when drowsy.
4. Change sleeping position
Although they have not been thoroughly researched, special products to avoid sleeping on your back may help some people reduce symptoms of obstructive sleep apnea.
5. Limit alcohol intake
Limiting alcohol and beer consumption can help treat sleep apnea. In people with untreated OSA, even drinking alcohol during the day can worsen breathing problems at night.
